verses.roman:
'nirgrantha hañā'--ei duṅhāra 'viśeṣaṇa'
āra artha śuna, yaiche sādhura saṅgama

synonyms: nirgrantha hañā—becoming nirgrantha; ei—this; duṅhāra—of both; viśeṣaṇa—the adjective; āra artha—another import; śuna—please hear; yaiche—in which; sādhura saṅgama—there is association with devotees.
translation: "The word nirgrantha is taken as an adjective modifying muni and ātmārāma. There is another meaning, which you may hear from Me, indicating association with a devotee. Now I shall explain how it is that through the association of devotees, even a nirgrantha can become a devotee.
